comment._content: A wonderful surprise! Thanks for uploading it and adding it to my Old Lanes group. A summary of the known views of charming old Clyde Street (demolished for the construction of Hickson Road) can be seen in the discussion here: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/4255176740/]

comment._content: this one's great. I actually don't think i've seen it before

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Trying to find exactly where in Clyde Street this was, but the Darling Harbour Resumption Maps (Plan F or G?) at the Photo Investigator site is not working for me . . . Boo-hoo! Not 100% sure; I think it was at the red dot above the letter "S" in Clyde Street on this 1895 map - www.nla.gov.au/apps/cdview?pi=nla.map-rm3443-sd&rgn=0...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw] Thanks for the fix. The relevant maps for Clyde Street are - Plan F - gallery.records.nsw.gov.au/wp-content/gallery/darling-har... Plan G - gallery.records.nsw.gov.au/wp-content/gallery/darling-har... I studied the maps and all the available photos of Clyde Street, including the City of Sydney ArchivePix, but I cannot match this archway, door, house and yard beyond. I think this is NOT Clyde Street. But where is it ... ?

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Curiouser and curiouser ....

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
Sorry folks, this is not Clyde Street. Caption in bottom left corner states 'Entrance to Parle's Buildings' while State Library of New South Wales copy on page 84 of The Old Rocks / N.S.W. Public Works Dept, call number PXE921 v3, has additional information that it is off Bettington Street..
JS

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw] Thanks JS, we'd all been a little confused about this one.
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Take a bow ...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] BRILLIANT DISCOVERY!! The archway shows up as an "X" on the Darling Harbour Resumption Plan E - gallery.records.nsw.gov.au/wp-content/gallery/darling-har... - and Parle's Buildings are marked and numbered very faintly. North (right) of the single "T" in "Bettington". West and behind the White Star Hotel which shows in several other Bettington Street photos. By my reckoning about here on Google Maps Satellite (the hillside was excavated for wharf space, but is about to be 'restored' in the Barangaroo project) - maps.google.com/maps?hl=en&ll=-33.857971,151.201571&a... Golly that is good to get that sorted out ! And, most importantly, it is a wonderful image, not least because of the children and their billy cart. .

comment.author: 65619666@N08
comment._content: Hi folks. A more detailed guide to the projections can be found on the website as of now! unguardedmoments.com.au. And thanks for the clarification re: Bettington St - and for generally fascinating banter. Has anyone seen the promo of this image on the Kent St bus shelter (as part of Art & About)? We spotted it only today. BTW there'll be a mini/informal tour of the projections happening on Thursday night 6 October if anyone is interested come along (let us know if you plan to join). Probably will cancel if it's bucketing down...
